availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Maupin, Jr. (Madison County, KY, soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George Washington Maupin, Sr. and Susan Maupin. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Resident in Madison County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as second lieutenant from September 1862 to November 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 228B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 501.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 405.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 453.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Yates, p. 327.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 60.
Find A Grave, "George Washington Maupin, Jr (1842-1893)," Memorial #71631735, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71631735# (accessed December 7, 2018).
